headline: One of Blackstone’s Top-Ranking Women to Leave Firm
summary: Blackstone’s  global co-head of real estate  Kathleen McCarthy Baldwin,  one of Wall Street’s highest-ranking female executives, said Tuesday she plans to leave the firm at the end of the year.  Nadeem Meghji,  the firm’s other co-head of real estate, will become the unit’s sole head following her departure, the firm said.  McCarthy Baldwin, 47, joined Blackstone’s real-estate business in 2010 in an investor-relations role and became its chief operating officer three years later.

headline: 2 Volatile Stocks for Long-Term Investors and 1 Facing Headwinds
summary: Volatility cuts both ways - while it creates opportunities, it also increases risk, making sharp declines just as likely as big gains. This unpredictability can shake out even the most experienced investors.
